    • Constructor Detail

      • CRC_Quiz

        public CRC_Quiz(Chinese_Remainder context)
        User wants to take a quiz. Only sets up the basics, including hiding the conventional time! Then it calls show_question, where quiz-specific interface issues and the rest should occur. Children should call this via super() before performing their own setup, and should always call show_question() after performing their own setup.
        Parameters:
        context - the Chinese_Remainder context
        See Also:
        show_question()

    • Method Detail

      • show_question

        public abstract void show_question()
        Create a new quiz question. This is the place to start a new dialog, which in its turn should invoke (directly or otherwise) accept_answer().
        See Also:
        accept_answer(int, int)

      • accept_answer

        public abstract void accept_answer(int hr,
                                   int min)
        User has answered quiz question. This function processes the answer. If the quiz is not complete, a new question is generated; otherwise, a result w/a light-hearted comment is displayed in an AlertDialog.
        Parameters:
        hr - the hour entered by the user
        min - the minute entered by the user
        See Also:
        ()

      • react_to_answer

        public void react_to_answer(int hr,
                            int min)
        Reacts to the answer, perhaps displaying a new AlertDialog or a Toast. Call this from show_question(). This is optional, and the default does nothing.

      • quiz_cancelled

        public void quiz_cancelled()
        Quiz was cancelled. Restores visibility of various views and, if appropriate, restarts the clock. Call this from either accept_answer() or react_to_answer(), probably after performing your own cleanup.
